intro: Chromolaena latisquamulosa, commonly known as the broad-scale chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its robust growth habit and distinctive, broad, overlapping leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clustered heads, which are typical of the daisy family. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and clearings due to its adaptability and rapid growth. Chromolaena latisquamulosa is also known for its potential as an invasive species in some areas.
